results.title: Muscular system [b&w]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
This film looks at the three types of muscle in the human musculature system. The structure of the muscle, the nerve impulse and the chemical process of muscular movement are explained.

results.title: Circulatory System [B&W]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
Animation, cinefluorography, drawings, and close-ups of live organs are used in analysing the entire circulatory system. Explains in detail the functions of the heart, lungs, and kidneys; follows the flow of blood through all parts of the body; and explains the role of the circulatory system in maintaining good health.

results.title: The Chemistry of digestion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
Nutrient molecules in food are too large to be absorbed into the body. Through the chemical processes of digestion, these nutrients are split into small, component molecules that can be absorbed. Animation, X-ray footage and laboratory demonstrations illustrate the major steps in the digestion of carbohydrates, fats and proteins.

results.title: The Road to interdependence
results.creator_credit: Paul Auerswald, Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The History of United States foreign relations”.
A commentary by the U.S. Department of State, on United States foreign relations since the second World War, using original film clippings. It emphasises the role of the United States in such events as the Cold War, Vietnam and the Middle East Crisis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Auerswald, Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope Productions

results.title: The Reluctant world power
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The History of United States foreign relations”.
The third in a series which traces the development of American foreign relations. The period between 1914 and 1941 was one in which America was torn between the policies of isolationism and involvement outside its boundaries. Focuses on Wilson’s policies of involvement in European affairs during and after the First World War. A backlash caused a return to isolationism in the 1920s and 1930s which was followed by partial involvement in Europe at the beginning of World War II and America’s full commitment to the war in Europe and the Pacific in 1941.
